column5: çŸ® (Çi)Means short in height, low in stature, or small in size. It specifically refers to the vertical dimension of an object or a person's height.çŸ­ (duÇn)Means short in length or duration, or brief in time. column5: è®² (jiÇng)Means to speak, talk, or give a speech. It is often used in the context of delivering a lecture, presentation, or formal speech.è¯´ (shuÅ)Means to speak, say, or talk. It is a more general term and can be used in various contexts, such as everyday conversation, storytelling, or expressing an opinion.For example, you would use è®² (jiÇng) when referring to giving a lecture or presentation, while è¯´ (shuÅ) is used in everyday conversation or when expressing thoughts or opinions.
